messages.content: ComfyUI-IC-Light is a native implementation of IC-Light, a model developed by lllyasviel, for use in ComfyUI.

The recommended way to install ComfyUI-IC-Light is by using the manager, which should not require any extra requirements. It can also be installed manually by cloning the repo to the 'ComfyUI/custom_nodes' folder.
Where can the models for ComfyUI-IC-Light be found?

The models for ComfyUI-IC-Light are available through the Manager by searching for 'IC-light'. By default, they are placed in the 'ComfyUI/models/unet/IC-Light' folder. They can also be downloaded from 'https://huggingface.co/lllyasviel/ic-light/tree/main' and placed anywhere in the 'ComfyUI/models/unet' folder.
What are some of the example workflows for ComfyUI-IC-Light?
Some of the example workflows for ComfyUI-IC-Light require the latest features in KJNodes, which can be found at 'https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-KJNodes'.
Who is credited for the development of the original IC-Light models?
lllyasviel is credited for the development of the original IC-Light models.
Where can the original repository for IC-Light be found?
The original repository for IC-Light can be found at 'https://github.com/lllyasviel/IC-Light'.
What are some examples of images generated using ComfyUI-IC-Light?

Example images generated using ComfyUI-IC-Light include 'ic_light_fbc_example_01', 'ic_light_example_02', and 'ic_light_fbc_example_01', which can be found in the examples folder of the ComfyUI-IC-Light repository.
